metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

Documentation_Link.Text:
AT_readme.txt
Air Temperature
Raw, clean and gap-filled data are available.
Variable Descriptions: R*ut: upper canopy temperature, units=deg C R*lt: lower canopy temperature, units=deg C R*uat: upper canopy aspirated temperature, units=deg C R*lat: lower canopy aspirated temperature, units=deg C R*at: air temperature, units=deg C
Note: R* refers to plot number (1-8). R*ut and R*lt are available for plots 1-6(R1-R6). R*uat and R*ult are available for plots 1(R1) and 4(R4). R*at is available for plots 7(R7) and 8(R8).

PRECIP_readme.txt
Precipitation
Raw, clean and gap-filled data are available.
Variable Descriptions: R*PT: precipitation throughfall, units=mm R*PO: precipitation, units=mm
Note: R* refers to plot number R(1-8). PT was measured at plots 1(R1),2(R2),3(R3),4(R4),5(R5),6(R6), and 8(R8). PO was measured at plots 4(R4) and 7(R7). A single measurement representing PO at FACE is available as gap-filled data.

RH_readme.txt
Humidity
Raw, clean and gap-filled data are available.
Variable Description: R*urh: upper canopy relative humidity, units=absolute R*usvp: upper canopy saturated vapor pressure, units=kPa R*uvpd: upper canopy vapor pressure deficit, units=kPa R*lrh: lower canopy relative humidity, units=absolute R*lsvp: lower canopy saturated vapor pressure, units=kPa R*lvpd: lower canopy vapor pressure deficit, units=kPa R*uarh: upper canopy aspirated relative humidity, units=absolute R*uasvp: upper canopy aspirated saturated vapor pressure, units=kPa R*uavpd: upper canopy aspirated vapor pressure deficit, units=kPa R*larh: lower canopy aspirated relative humidity, units=absolute R*lasvp: lower canopy aspirated saturated vapor pressure, units=kPa R*lavpd: lower canopy aspirated vapor pressure deficit, units=kPa
Note: R* refers to plot number (1-8)

RAD_readme.txt
Radiation
Raw and clean data are available.
Variable Descriptions: R4NR: R4 net radiation, units=Wm^-2 R4PAR: R4 photosynthetic active radiation, units=mmol photons m^-2 S^-1 R5NR: R5 net radiation, units=Wm^-2 R7PAR: R& photosynthetic active radiation, units=mmol photons m^-2 s^-1
Radiation data are available for plot numbers 4(R4), 5(R5), and 7(R7).

CDIAC.Thematic_area: Vegetation response to CO2 and Climate
CDIAC.Descriptive_file:
http://cdiac.ornl.gov/ftp/FACE/dukedata/met_data/temp-rh-vpd/2004_current/air_temp/AT_readme.txtAT_readme.txt
Air Temperature
Raw, clean and gap-filled data are available.
Variable Descriptions: R*ut: upper canopy temperature, units=deg C R*lt: lower canopy temperature, units=deg C R*uat: upper canopy aspirated temperature, units=deg C R*lat: lower canopy aspirated temperature, units=deg C R*at: air temperature, units=deg C
Note: R* refers to plot number (1-8). R*ut and R*lt are available for plots 1-6(R1-R6). R*uat and R*ult are available for plots 1(R1) and 4(R4). R*at is available for plots 7(R7) and 8(R8).

http://cdiac.ornl.gov/ftp/FACE/dukedata/met_data/precip-rad-par/2004_current/precipitation/PRECIP_readme.txtPRECIP_readme.txt
Precipitation
Raw, clean and gap-filled data are available.
Variable Descriptions: R*PT: precipitation throughfall, units=mm R*PO: precipitation, units=mm
Note: R* refers to plot number R(1-8). PT was measured at plots 1(R1),2(R2),3(R3),4(R4),5(R5),6(R6), and 8(R8). PO was measured at plots 4(R4) and 7(R7). A single measurement representing PO at FACE is available as gap-filled data.

Humidity
Raw, clean and gap-filled data are available.
Variable Description: R*urh: upper canopy relative humidity, units=absolute R*usvp: upper canopy saturated vapor pressure, units=kPa R*uvpd: upper canopy vapor pressure deficit, units=kPa R*lrh: lower canopy relative humidity, units=absolute R*lsvp: lower canopy saturated vapor pressure, units=kPa R*lvpd: lower canopy vapor pressure deficit, units=kPa R*uarh: upper canopy aspirated relative humidity, units=absolute R*uasvp: upper canopy aspirated saturated vapor pressure, units=kPa R*uavpd: upper canopy aspirated vapor pressure deficit, units=kPa R*larh: lower canopy aspirated relative humidity, units=absolute R*lasvp: lower canopy aspirated saturated vapor pressure, units=kPa R*lavpd: lower canopy aspirated vapor pressure deficit, units=kPa

http://cdiac.ornl.gov/ftp/FACE/dukedata/met_data/precip-rad-par/2004_current/radiation/RAD_readme.txtRAD_readme.txt
Radiation
Raw and clean data are available.
Variable Descriptions: R4NR: R4 net radiation, units=Wm^-2 R4PAR: R4 photosynthetic active radiation, units=mmol photons m^-2 S^-1 R5NR: R5 net radiation, units=Wm^-2 R7PAR: R& photosynthetic active radiation, units=mmol photons m^-2 s^-1
Radiation data are available for plot numbers 4(R4), 5(R5), and 7(R7).
CDIAC.Notes:
Precipitation, Net radiation, and PAR data files (1998, rings 4 and 5): First four columns show precipitation (mm) and net radiation (W/m^2). Ring 4 measures overstory precipitation (po), and ring 5 measures throughfall (pt). The last data column shows PAR (millimol/m^2*s).
Air temperature, Relative Humidity, SVP, and VPD (r1 - r6): Data columns are organised by ring number. For each ring there is: - Temperature (Degrees C) - Relative humidity (absolute values) - SVP (Saturated Vapor Pressure - kPa) - VPD (Vapor Pressure Deficit - kPa) measurements are done at 2/3 of canopy height
Note: gap-filled data are available for some variables and years.
